item.title: Amy add a quote by Anatoly Rybakov
item.description: "There must be those who differ. If there were no unorthodox thought there would be no thought at all" -- Anatoly Rybakov

item.title: Amy add a quote by Norman Mailer
item.description: "Harsh words live in the dungeon of the heart" -- Norman Mailer

item.title: Amy add a quote by Norman Mailer
item.description: "I am not here only so that the blind might see, but to teach those who thought they could see that they are blind" -- Norman Mailer

item.title: Amy add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "If you judge people, you have no time to love them." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Amy add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "To give pleasure to a single heart by a single act is better than a thousand heads bowing in prayer." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Amy add a quote by Susan B. Anthony
item.description: "Resistance to tyranny ius obedience to God" -- Susan B. Anthony

item.title: Amy add a quote by Tom Waits
item.description: "Your old home town's so far away, but inside your head there's a record that's playing, a song called 'Hold On" -- Tom Waits

item.title: Amy add a quote by Mark Knopfler
item.description:
"There should be laughter after pain, there should be sunlight after rain, these things have always been the same, so why worry now?"
[<em>Why Worry?</em>]" -- Mark Knopfler

item.title: Amy add a quote by Richard Paul Evans
item.description: "Could it be that to truly love a thing is not to desire it, but to desire happiness for it?" -- Richard Paul Evans

item.title: Amy add a quote by Richard Paul Evans
item.description: "We all got things under our skin. Everybody does. Like a glass sliver. Can't see nothin' there, but it works its way in deeper and gets to festerin' and hurts so that we're ready to just cut the whole thing out." -- Richard Paul Evans

item.title: Amy add a quote by Richard Paul Evans, "The Letter"
item.description: "The noble causes of life have always seemed foolish to the uninspired. But that is of small conern. I worry less about the crucified than those who pounded the nails." -- Richard Paul Evans, "The Letter"

item.title: Amy add a quote by Dean Koontz
item.description: "The sky is deep, the sky is dark. The light of the stars is o damn stark/When I look up, I fill with fear, if all we have is what lies here, this lonely world, this troubled place, then cold dead stars and empty space...Well, I see no reason to persevere, no reason to laugh or shed a tear, no reason to sleep and none to wake/ No promises to keep and none to make. And so at night I still raise my eyes tos tudy the clear but mysterious skies that arch avove us, cold as stone. Are you there God? Are we alone?" -- Dean Koontz

item.title: Amy add a quote by Anatoly Rybakov
item.description: "You could kill a man, but you could never break him." -- Anatoly Rybakov

item.title: Amy add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The trouble is not in dying for a friend, but in finding a friend worth dying for." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Amy add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "The most pathetic person in the world is some one who has sight but no vision." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Amy add a quote by Saigyo
item.description: "Every single thing changes and is changing always in this world. Yet with the same light the moon goes on shining." -- Saigyo

item.title: Amy add a quote by Sylvia Boorstein PhD
item.description: "Life is painful, suffering is optional." -- Sylvia Boorstein PhD

item.title: Amy add a quote by William R. Inge
item.description: "Religion is a way of walking, not a way of talking." -- William R. Inge

item.title: Amy add a quote by George Herbert
item.description: "The shortest answer is doing." -- George Herbert

item.title: Amy add a quote by Han Suyin
item.description: "There is nothing stronger in this world than gentleness." -- Han Suyin

item.title: Amy add a quote by Ken Kesey
item.description: "Good writin' ain't necessarily good readin'." -- Ken Kesey

item.title: Amy add a quote by Andy Warhol
item.description: "They always say time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself." -- Andy Warhol

item.title: Amy add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "The question of how things will settle down is the only important question..." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Amy add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Amy add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Our lives begin to end the day we become silent about things that matter." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Amy add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Enough or not...it will have to do" -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Amy add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "presume nothing" -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Amy add a quote by Bram Stoker
item.description: "There is a reason why all things are as they are." -- Bram Stoker

item.title: Amy add a quote by Dennis Miller
item.description: "Jack Kerouac was cool because he had no idea he was." -- Dennis Miller

item.title: Amy add a quote by George Dawson
item.description: "Things will be alright. People need to hear that. Life is good, just as it is. There isn't anything that I would change about my life." -- George Dawson
